measured_by: decision-making tasks with fluctuating rewards and punishments
justification: “Participants performed decision-making tasks characterized by fluctuating rewards and punishment,” indicating the task served as the instrument for assessing decision-making under uncertainty.
The article states that “the punishment learning rate” was one of the three fitted parameters of the winning model, directly indexing how quickly participants learned from negative outcomes.
The authors list the “lapse parameter” as a key output of the computational model, reflecting the extent of random choice behaviour.

topic_or_construct: value decay / forgetting in reinforcement learning
justification: The text refers to the model’s “decay rate” parameter, which captures how rapidly past information is discounted, thus operationalising the construct of value decay or forgetting.
